div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1569 "Kefir," Syria ?, 1910 (543) Burial: c. 100 B.C. (M) Contents: 17+ AR Tyre: tetradr. (yrs. 5-25) Disposition: Istanbul Regling saw 17 There is a Kefer in Syria c. 15 km. N of Idlib, but more probably "Kefir" represents Arab Kafr, Kefr etc. (vil- lage) used in countless composite place names all over the area
